args: Is this article primarily about a new action or announcement by the Trump administration/White House/Executive? Respond simply with "yes" or "no" . Senate panel advances McMahon’s nomination for education secretary On a party-line vote, the Senate Health, Education, Labor and Pensions Committee voted Thursday to advance the nomination of Linda McMahon as secretary of education. The tally was 12-11 to send her nomination to the Senate floor, where she is expected to be confirmed. “We need a strong leader at the department who will get our education system back on track, and Ms. McMahon is the right person for the job,” said Sen. Bill Cassidy (R-Louisiana), chairman of the committee. Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-Vermont) said he cannot support a nominee intent on implementing President Donald Trump’s agenda, which includes trying to close or diminish the Education Department. “It doesn’t really matter who the secretary will be, because he or she will not have the power,” Sanders said. As for McMahon, he said, “I respect her, I like her, but I will vote no.” At her confirmation hearing last week, McMahon acknowledged that only Congress has the power to close the Education Department, but said she would look to reduce its power. She tried to assure Democrats that she would not cut popular programs that fund high-poverty schools and subsidize the cost of educating students with disabilities.
